Mr. J wrote:
> 
> Hi Folks,
> 
> I am crawling a site and it has been running for 54 hrs and 99% crawl
> job.  Normally it runs about 24 hr in the couple of last crawl.  I am
> pretty sure I have all I want.  I am guessing it might hang or retring
> some url that's not much important for me.  Is there any way I cleanly
> stop the current job ??  I saw about 4 arc file with extension open
> right now.  

I suggest first pausing the crawl, then using the Frontier report
or 'view or edit frontier URIs' option (which only appears in a
paused crawl) to verify the few straggler URIs are of no interest.

The 'terminate current job' link should end any paused crawl cleanly.
(If in any case it does not, that's a bug.)

If your crawls are small and you want fewer misc-sized ARC files
at the end, you can decrease the ARCWriter's pool size. If set to
1, only one ARC will ever be open at a time -- but multiple
threads can get momentarily held up waiting for their chance
to write to that single file.

- Gordon @ IA
